search.query: | cyencesusermanager operation="getusers" | table * | search $tkn_user_filter$ $tkn_user_type_filter$ $tkn_product_filter$ | eval user_row_selector=uuid

html.p: User Inventory generator report needs to be enabled.

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/cyences_app_for_splunk/saved/searches count=0 splunk_server=local | search "eai:acl.app"="cyences_app_for_splunk" title IN ("User Inventory - Lookup Gen", "User Inventory - Lookup CleanUp", "User Inventory - Merge Similar Users", "User Inventory - Lookup Backfill") | table title, disabled | rename title as label | eval status=if(disabled=1, "Report is disabled", "Report is enabled") | table label, status

html.p: If you are looking at the User Inventory for the first time and you don't see all the available users in the table below then you can manually execute User Inventory - Lookup Backfill report to fill the lookup. (By default it runs over last 15 days of time to collect the user inventory.)
Description: The total number of users available.
Note: Click on any of the surrounding bar charts to view more information about specific users in the User Inventory. Click on the number above to reset the filter.

chart.title: Number of Users That Are Connected To A Specific Product

search.query: | mvexpand product_names | eval Product = case(match(product_names,"Microsoft Office 365*"), "Microsoft Office 365", match(product_names,"Google*"), "Google", 1==1, product_names) | stats count as Users by Product

html.p: Description: The total number of users that are connected to a particular product.

chart.title: Number of Users by Its Type

search.query: | mvexpand user_types | stats count as Users by user_types | rename user_types as "User Type"

html.p: Description: Each column represents the total number of users by its type or role or category.

search.query: | search $tkn_sp_filter$ | rename users as User, user_types as "User Types", product_names as Products, is_privileged_user as IsPrivilegedUser | table user_row_selector, IsPrivilegedUser, User, "User Types",Products, uuid | eval "View Related Logs" = "Click Here" | nomv User
